At Grant Thornton, YOU are at the heart of everything we do.
Starting your graduate program at Grant Thornton is a remarkable step in your career. From day one, you’ll be an integral part of our team – working alongside some of Australia’s leading industry experts on complex projects for a range of dynamic and emerging business.
Exciting? Absolutely! But we also know that starting as a graduate can be overwhelming.
That’s why when you join us as a new graduate, you’ll be supported every step of the way. Starting as part of our national cohort, you’ll take part in a comprehensive induction and training program to ensure you’ve got the skills to hit the ground running.
In addition to ample formal learning sessions, you’ll also receive plenty of on-the-job learning opportunities as well as regular coaching and feedback from your team leaders. We want you to learn more, be inspired to expand your horizons and discover exactly what you’re capable of.
Our open and team based structure will give you the opportunity to interact with senior business leaders from early in your career, and you will have exposure to a wide variety of clients, benefiting from the knowledge and experience of your colleagues along the way.
YOUR OPPORTUNITY
Opportunities are available for motivated and passionate graduates to join our Melbourne Risk Consulting team in 2023.
Our Risk Consulting team is a growing national business responsible for delivering consulting and assurance engagements that deal with controls assurance, internal audit, cyber security and resilience, project/program assurance, as well as governance and general risk management. The team’s overarching purpose is to help our clients to navigate complex risks and change management issues in a dynamic business environment.
This opportunity would be highly suited for soon-to-be graduates with degree backgrounds including (but not limited to): Information Technology, Data Analytics/ Data Science, Cyber Security, Business and Commerce.
YOUR CAREER, YOUR WAY
You’ve studied hard and now you deserve the best start to your career. We understand that no two careers are the same, that’s why we’re committed to developing and supporting graduates like you who are looking to carve out a career that’s uniquely yours. The possibilities are endless – where you take your career and how fast you get there is up to you.
A FIRM THAT IS AS UNIQUE AS YOU
Here, we do things differently. We’re not just a leader in accounting and advisory services – we have an approach that’s uniquely Grant Thornton. Our team is shaping growth strategies for our clients and influencing our firm’s culture and future with their own voices and experiences. We care for our people, clients and communities and support them to thrive.
Our size and success mean we can offer remarkable opportunities as you develop your career. With a global network spanning more than 135 countries, we have the reach to take your where you want to go.
YOUR LIFE @ GRANT THORNTON
We understand work is just one aspect of your life so along with a competitive salary you’ll have access to a wide variety of benefits including free gym membership, social events and clubs, volunteer days, corporate discounts and paid study support and leave.
We are proud to be a workplace that champions a culture of inclusion and diversity where our people are supported, connected and heard. We recognise the importance of individual flexible work options and family friendly work practices in maintaining diverse, adaptive and high performing teams. To support you we are committed to growing authentic and inclusive leaders who create a vibrant and collaborative working environment. Leaders encourage your unique perspective and support you to be your whole self every day as you steer the career path you planned. Collaboration, Authenticity, Responsibility and Excellence (CARE) are our values and guide us in supporting our people, our clients and our community to thrive.
Grant Thornton strives for equity, diversity, and inclusion in the workplace. We strongly encourage female candidates, Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander peoples, people from diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds, people from the LGBTI+ community and people with disability to apply. Click here to see more of our inclusive culture in action.
SOUND LIKE YOU?
You’ll come with a variety of strengths and motivations ready to contribute and connect with our clients, our purpose, our values and our culture and want to make an impact right from the start. It’s not just about the academics, but also what else inspires you to care as much as we do.
In addition to studying a relevant qualification, you’ll be curious, aspirational and value the things we value.
empowered - You will not be afraid to challenge convention, to have a voice and to contribute your views, experiences and passions to help shape our firm’s culture and future.
supported - You’ll prioritise learning in an environment where you are free to try new things and be guided by leaders who remember what it was like to start their careers and foster a culture of clear and constructive feedback.
inspired - You’ll embrace diversity, flexibility and respect the unique strengths and qualities each member of your team will bring. You’ll be energised by collaborating with those around you and lean into challenge and new experiences.
In addition to this, you must be on track to complete your studies by the end of 2022 or have completed a relevant undergraduate or postgraduate degree within the last two years.
YOUR APPLICATION
Applications will close at 11.55 pm AEST on Monday, 15 August 2022. Positions are limited so apply early to avoid disappointment.
If you require any reasonable adjustments to assist you throughout the recruitment process, please contact Kate Minns, Early Careers Manager on 03 8663 6436 or at earlycareers@au.gt.com to discuss your application and your individual needs.

Job description
NJC Labs is a leading Technology and Solutions Company with presence in US, UK, Australia and India. Leveraging on years of Integration experience and consulting experience, the Company has pioneered in the field of IT and Integration services. At NJC Labs, we believe in a culture of partnership, mutual respect and trust. You will have a fast-paced environment focused on continuous improvement. Our “People first” mantra has done wonders and it reflects in each and every step we take starting from hiring the best and treating everyone as the best. Here at NJC Labs, you will deal with cutting edge integration technologies and innovative solutions. There is a great emphasis on knowledge and learning. We believe in a highly collaborative culture based on trust and transparency as a way of life. You will have a clear plan and transparency into your career, and we believe that a happy and empowered team member can do wonders for us. We also firmly believe in work-life balance, which is reflected in our focused, stimulating and fun work environments.
As a NJC Labs team member you’ll receive a competitive remuneration and benefits package. You’ll work in an exciting, fun filled, very positive environment with a very flat structure, while still enjoying the benefits of a highly corporate environment. NJC Labs is still young and you will be at the forefront of shaping our young enterprise, and contributing to our success as a partner.
Our partnership and deep relationship with organizations like Salesforce / MuleSoft offers you unrivalled access and insight into various products and opportunities. We are looking for ambitious, technical professionals looking for challenges and growth. You will join a fast-growing organization that can shape you into a well-rounded professional while ensuring quality work-life balance. NJC labs is a family, and we work as a team, collaborate, enable, inspire, care and support each other to achieve our goals. Join and work with a successful team who puts “people” and “customers” first. If you are a passionate professional who is eager to join a growing organization and has what it takes to work as a valued member of the global leading digital integration team at NJC Labs, we’d love to talk to you.
Eligibility
Eligible and Qualified candidates should have Bachelors/Masters in computer science or any equivalent degree.
4 years of work experience in software development, out of which 2 years in JAVA
One year experience in integration is preferred
Experience in any of the legacy integration tools like TIBCO/Oracle Fusion/ Webmethods / BizTalk is highly desirable
Good Communication skills.
Ability to present Complex ideas in a clear, concise way.
While you have Ability to understand the big picture, you are also able to stay focused on the task at hand.
Great at systematic and accurate research and also detail oriented
Have amazing work ethics and team player
Who can apply:
AU Citizens/ Permanent resident / Graduates on Temporary Resident Visa
Process
Qualified candidates will go through NJC Labs Accelerator program to empower them to be corporate ready. This program spans around various aspects of grooming you to be corporate ready. Our program focuses on developing qualified candidates into a well-rounded technologist. Apart from all the soft skill training, we focus on enhancing your skills in Java, Integration Platform Tools, Data science and AI from a technology point of view. Based on your skill level, career goals and organizational needs, we will be assigning you onto one of our accelerator programs.
A non- employment agreement will be in place with You until you successfully complete NJC Labs Accelerator program.
Below mentioned benefits will be provided after you have successfully completed our Accelerated program and are assigned to a project:
Transparent and Flexi compensation policy.
Increment would be at least a minimum of 7% to 15% according to the performance.
Relocation charges will be provided to you during your project migration.
On-job technical support during the project.
Interested Candidates please apply.

Salary: $30,000.00 – $90,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Work from home
Schedule:
8 hour shift

Join us on our mission to make a better world of work.
Culture Amp is the world's most trusted Employee Experience platform. Our mission is to create a better world of work for 100 million people by helping companies put their people and culture first.
We do this by bringing together pioneering people science and powerful technology. Over 3000 companies like Airbnb, Slack, and Deliveroo trust Culture Amp to collect, understand and connect data throughout the employee experience. The insights help them truly understand their people and guide them on the best actions to drive positive behaviour change and lasting impact. We live in a world where the ability to understand and influence culture at scale is no longer a 'nice-to-have' but a 'necessary-to-survive'.
We have a remote-first culture and this position can be based anywhere from Australia or New Zealand. This role can be fully remote or a hybrid if you are in Melbourne. We encourage you to work in the way that best suits you.
How you can help make a better world of work
Culture Amp is looking for a Director of Data Science to lead the strategy and operations of our data science practice.
Data Science at Culture Amp is distributed across a number of cross-functional teams, working on initiatives ranging from original research on the world of work, to ML product development. We're looking for someone to elevate this practice and set it up for the next stage of Culture Amp's growth, by:
Defining and executing on strategic goals for the data science practice to increase its impact internally and externally, through technology, skill development, and collaboration
Creating a clear career path for data scientists at Culture Amp to grow and develop their skills
Making sure that we have the right people, that they are working in the appropriate parts of the company, and that they have the skills necessary for a particular project
Identifying and effectively prioritising opportunities to unlock new capabilities and use cases through rich and trustworthy data and analysis
Collaborating with those across Product Group and around the business to influence change and bring ideas to life
Working alongside technical experts to build the data science technical stack to ensure success at scale
What You Bring to Our Camp
Strong leadership skills and experience developing and growing teams and individuals
Strong knowledge of statistical methods, modelling, and research methodology
Communication and influencing. Engage and collaborate with diverse internal and external stakeholders to achieve shared understanding and vision.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques and algorithms
Experience with programming languages and modelling tools such as SQL, R, and Python.
Problem solver with a curious mindset that drives you to ask and answer the 'why'
Research skills. Systematically collect qualitative and quantitative inputs, draw on sharp analytical skills, intuition and empathy to find non-obvious patterns, and distil it all into actionable insights.
You are deeply curious and passionate about people and culture. At heart, you're what we call a people geek!
Please keep reading...
Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and other marginalised folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.
Non average workplaces attract above average people.
We consider ourselves anything but average and strive to make a home for different types of people from around the world to do their best work and have fun doing it. So we have created 4 "not your average" values that we live by, check it out on our website and if this sounds like the environment for you, please apply!
We are committed to not only making a better world of work, but also a better world. So we are proud to be recognised as a certified B-Corp.
We believe that inclusive businesses are better, not just for "company results", but for the world. We have a strong commitment to Anti-Racism, and endeavour to lead by example. Every step we make as a business towards anti-racism is another step we can support our customers in making a better world (of work). You can see our current commitments to Anti-Racism on our website.
We ensure you have the tools you need to thrive both in and out of work.
MacBooks for you to do your best work
Share Options - it's important to us that everyone is an owner and can share in our success
Excellent parental leave and in work support programme, - for those families to be
Flexible working schedule - where we can, let's make work, work for you
Fun and inclusive digital, and (in the future) in-person events
Most importantly. An opportunity to really make a difference in people's lives.

Outstanding candidates are encouraged to apply for positions now open at Peter MacCallum Cancer Centre – a place where our normal days are extraordinary; as are the people we care for.

Peter Mac is one of a handful of integrated cancer research, education and treatment centres in the world. Each day our team strives to provide the very best in cancer care, even better treatments and potential cancer cures for all people affected by cancer.

Globally, we are facing one of the most pivotal times in the pursuit of cancer cures, and Peter Mac stands at its forefront. Together, we aim to lead a new era of cancer prevention, care and discovery, supported by state-of-the-art facilities at our new home within the Victorian Comprehensive Cancer Centre building.

Fixed Term Full Time

Your role in our future.

As a Clinical Trials Assistant (CTA) you will work to support the Clinical Trial Project Managers on the various tasks associated with running clinical trials within the Centre for Biostatistics and Clinical Trials (BaCT) and PMCC.

BaCT has been operating within PMCC for 40 years and provide statistical, project management and data management support for investigator initiated studies.

Key Selection Criteria:

Tertiary qualification in health science or related discipline

Strong general administrative skills and experience

Excellent organisational skills and attention to detail.

Excellent communication skills.

Able to work independently.

Ability to working as an effective member of a multi-disciplinary team.

For further information about this opportunity, please review the position description or contact us for a confidential discussion.

Peter Mac requires its staff to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please contact us if you would like to discuss this requirement.

Why work for Peter Mac:


Peter Mac offer a range of benefits which support our people both personally and professionally.

Our staff benefits include award winning facilities, professional development and events, a health and wellbeing program, flexible work practices and policies and financial benefits such as salary packaging.

We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, all members of the LGBTQI community and people with a disability.

Job no: 0052338
Location: Parkville
Role type: Full time/ Fixed-term until June 2024
Faculty: Faculty of Medicine, Dentistry and Health Sciences
Department/School: Department of General Practice
Salary: Level B – $110,236 - $130,900 p.a. plus 17% super
The University of Melbourne would like to acknowledge and pay respect to the Traditional Owners of the lands upon which our campuses are situated, the Wurundjeri and Boon Wurrung Peoples, the Yorta Yorta Nation, the Dja Dja Wurrung People. We acknowledge that the land on which we meet and learn was the place of age-old ceremonies, of celebration, initiation and renewal, and that the local Aboriginal Peoples have had and continue to have a unique role in the life of these lands.
About the Department of General Practice
The Department of General Practice originated as a unit within the Department of Community Medicine in 1977. It was established as a separate department within the School of Medicine in 2001 and established the Primary Care Research Unit (PCRU) as a centre of excellence in primary care research, research training and knowledge exchange in 2006.

About the Role
The successful candidate is expected to utilise multiple data sources presenting real-world evidence on the incidence and diagnostic/treatment patterns for cancer patients. As a member of the Data Driven Research Hub team, you will support the data-hub manager with the identification and linkage of relevant datasets required for the Cancer in Primary Care and Health Services Research programs and work with health economists and higher degree students to support research on value-based diagnostic testing
Responsibilities include:
Providing expertise and leadership to the VCCC research data program and develop the required analytic capabilities to perform and advise on cancer health services research on linked datasets.
Working closely with the manager of the data-hub and the staff of BioGrid Australia to support the development of the VCCC Data Hub and promote its use for health services research across the VCCC.
Working with the data-hub manager, VCCC hospital health information managers and researchers to understand the assumptions inherent in data collection, including primary care data, so that unstandardised datasets can be effectively utilised for research.
About You
You are a confident communicator with an ability to work collaboratively within a research team to achieve project goals and meet deadlines. You are highly organised with excellent time management skills to work on multiple tasks independently and with flexibility to respond to changing priorities.
You will also have:
A Masters or PhD in relevant scientific discipline such as data sciences, biomedical statistics, computer sciences or others, with a demonstrated interest in health services research or systems improvement
A track record of working collaboratively in a research team to achieve project goals and manage time effectively to meet deadlines
Evidence of your ability to work independently in data cleaning, linkage, descriptive and inferential statistics and apply research methodologies and quantitative data analyses.
About the University
The University of Melbourne is consistently ranked amongst the leading universities in the world. We are proud of our people, our commitment to research and teaching excellence, and our global engagement.
Benefits of Working with Us
In addition to having the opportunity to grow and be challenged, and to be part of a vibrant campus life, our people enjoy a range of rewarding benefits:

Attractive Salary + Super + Salary Packaging Benefits

Create sustainable data management framework improving clinical care!

Who We Are

At MCRI we share a powerful vision; to re-imagine the future of child health. We are the home to many life-changing scientific discoveries. We believe that no question is too impossible to try and answer. We are renowned for our cutting edge focus on early interventions, improved diagnosis, prevention and development of potential cures. Our success is founded on a philosophy of collaboration through a multi-disciplinary approach to solving the toughest questions in child health. MCRI is committed to creating a culture of inclusivity, equity and respect that celebrates and values the diverse backgrounds and experiences of our people. We strive to foster a positive working environment that is underpinned by equal opportunity for all and consideration for the diverse voices of staff, students and the communities we serve. MCRI is a proud member of the Australian Network on Disability and is a committed subscriber to Science Australia Gender Equity and its principles.

The Opportunity at MCRI:
We are seeking a highly motivated and solutions focused Research Data Manager to join the team at MCRI! The institute is committed to creating a scalable and sustainable data management framework to accelerate research outputs and provide the evidence base to improve clinical care. Our research is increasingly data-rich, with the volume, variety and velocity of data being generated requiring structured data governance and sophisticated analytics to ensure maximise translational impact and data sharing.

In this role you will be responsible for defining and delivering a data sharing culture, procedure, advice and training to support research data management across the Institute. Our ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of the research data lifecycle and possess strong skills in data governance, data security and technologies. You will be confident in project planning and implementation at an organisation level in a fast paced and flexible environment. This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a passion for research and data to take the next step in their career!

Your Responsibilities include:
Delivering and developing a strategy to implement policies, standards and drive a data sharing culture across the institute.
Developing data governance policies and standards to maximise the impact of research data
Resolving research data security and establish data sharing practices
Define and facilitates implementation of a move to cloud storage
Driving SOPs for data acquisition, storage and analysis, and streamlining of ethics
Improving integration and access to external data sources, including the RCH EMR, and linkage to state/federal administrative datasets
Developing enterprise level solutions to data management and analysis problem

About You:
Masters/PhD degree in Statistics, Information Science, Computer Science, or a related field strongly preferred combined with significant relevant experience
At least five years of professional experience in a digital data governance/data quality leadership role
Applicable project / program management experience
Strong technical knowledge of data governance frameworks, architecture, infrastructure and technologies

How to Apply! You are invited to apply online via the MCRI Careers Portal.

Cover letter
Resume
Responses to ‘What we need from you’ via the Position Description

Here’s what we know for sure: companies work well when they’ve got the right people. That’s what inspired us to build a SaaS platform that makes recruiting, on-boarding, developing and retaining people simple. From humble beginnings in Melbourne, we quickly grew and now we’re proud to have homes in Sydney, New York, London, Singapore, Manila and Dublin and a platform that is used by 2.6 million customer employee users in over 190 countries. (But that’s enough about us.)
About the role
We have a large Postgres data warehouse and pipelines built using DBT, Python, Docker, Lambdas and other AWS technologies. It fuels the Reporting & Analytics offering for our some of our Customers as well as some internal data projection capabilities for product capabilities. As such, this itself is a fantastic technology space to work with. But that’s not all, we are keen to take this to the next level.
In the short term we are looking to transition all our customers to the new offering based on the technologies above with Looker being the front end for Analytics experience. That means we have to think enterprise scale and volume. We have some of the best tools in the business to enable system observability using OpenTelemetry & Honeycomb.
Overtime we want to grow into Data science, leveraging our data warehouse, pipeline & analytics capability to build a modern next generation data science and machine learning learning offering enabling the customer jobs to be done.
We are looking for someone who is excited about this journey, someone who has seen parts of this journey in previous workplaces, familiar with at least some of the technologies mentioned. This is a key role in building and influencing the long term outcome and has good potential for growth.
A key contributor to PageUp Data team in enabling modern reporting and Analytics roll out and a positioning for modern data science offerings.
Ability to get the ball rolling with hands on knowledge in Data pipelining, data modelling, related application development & SQL DB Skills.
Partner with Data analyst and Product Manager to build a roadmap along with Technical lead and contribute towards maturing the data capability in PageUp.
Experience & Skills
Data pipeline experience - Modern ETL’s
Date Warehousing Experience -
SQL/ Python experience preferable
Some application application development experience, exposure dotnet technology stack, aws, containers
Problem Solving skills
Communication skills
And of course, the perks
PageUp Product development team is THE FUN place to be in, especially the Platform Stream. You’ve got some excellent company waiting in the team. At PageUp, we know people come with various preferences and we value it, So there is something for everyone across our benefits – an extra day of leave to do something awesome (no really – it’s called Awesome Day), paid parental leave for primary and secondary carers, flexible working, a wellbeing allowance, employee assistance program and volunteer leave.
Our global presence also means those with a little wonderlust have the opportunity to take their career to new places. Pardon the pun.
Sound like your kind of role? Then we’d love to meet you!
At PageUp we know diverse teams make better decisions for everyone, so we encourage people of all backgrounds and abilities to apply.
Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women and those in other underrepresented groups tend to only apply when they match every criteria. So if you think you have what it takes, but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.

Will you actively create a healthier future for tomorrow?

At Medibank we’re encouraged to think big. We have a clear purpose to impact better health outcomes for our customers, patients and our community.

Our Story:
Home Support Services (HSS) which is part of the Medibank Enterprise, has been providing in-home healthcare services since 1989. We understand that Australians want more choice over where and when they receive care. Where clinically appropriate, our national home healthcare business, Home Support Services (HSS), offer people the flexibility of receiving healthcare and support services in alternative settings to hospitals, wherever they call ‘home’.
The Opportunity
This newly created role is a great opportunity for an experienced Analyst looking for a chance to make a real impact on an organisation. Acting as a trusted advisor to key internal stakeholders, you will have a great balance between the technical and commercial by way of extracting and analysing information as well as informing the business on how to best utilise the data to ensure best commercial outcomes.
This role is responsible for leveraging the systems capability provided by our customer data mart (CDM) and campaign management system (CMS) through developing customer contact extraction and analytics processes that ensure application of required compliance obligations is achieved and delivery of quality and timely customer contact is aligned to the overall marketing contact strategy.

Key responsibilities will include:
Implementing robust and repeatable data extraction processes to enable effective and compliant execution of campaigns and contact management strategy.
Maintaining campaign information maps, ensuring new data is available for campaign management and existing sources has desirable quality and reliability.
Providing campaigns/trigger leads to channels to support retention and advocacy objectives as well as increase upsell and cross-sell.
Ensuring all processes are compliant to regulatory requirements including PHI Act, Privacy Act, Spam Act, National DNC Register, Fund Policy Community Rating, Privacy Act and Spam Act.
Reviewing, monitoring and reporting on customer contact performance against the marketing plan business targets and category strategy (includes meeting company reporting timelines).

About You
You will have a commercial mindset with a passion for process improvement – challenging the status quo and creative input is encouraged. A natural communicator, you will be confident in building solid working relationships with and providing expert guidance to stakeholders at all levels of the organisation. As this role is a key influencer in business decisions that drive revenue growth for Medibank, excellent influencing abilities are a must. In terms of technical skills you will have:

qualifications in statistics, marketing, business, mathematics, computer science or similar.
demonstrated experience in a campaign data management role
Previous experience of contact/response management systems (SAS or UNICA) as well as programming in statistical software packages (SQL, SAS preferred)
Proven experience in using analytical insights to provide accurate advice to senior stakeholders and influence decision making

This is a 13 month fixed term contract position

Unrivalled opportunity to join and grow your career within a trusted and reputable organisation!

Who We Are

Murdoch Children’s Research Institute (MCRI)

At MCRI we share a powerful vision; to re-imagine the future of child health. We are the home to many life-changing scientific discoveries. We believe that no question is too impossible to try and answer. We are renowned for our cutting edge focus on early interventions, improved diagnosis, prevention and development of potential cures. Our success is founded on a philosophy of collaboration through a multi-disciplinary approach to solving the toughest questions in child health. MCRI is committed to creating a culture of inclusivity, equity and respect that celebrates and values the diverse backgrounds and experiences of our people. We strive to foster a positive working environment that is underpinned by equal opportunity for all and consideration for the diverse voices of staff, students and the communities we serve. MCRI is a proud member of the Australian Network on Disability and is a committed subscriber to Science Australia Gender Equity and its principles.

The Opportunity:
We are seeking a highly motivated Research Assistant to join in the Kidney Regeneration laboratory working within a team focussed on the generation of kidney organoids from pluripotent stem cells.

Our ideal candidate will possess a level of molecular and cell biology experience, with a preference for skills in cell/tissue culture, confocal microscopy, immunofluorescent staining, qRT-PCR, and flow cytometry. This role will be suited to someone with expertise in pluripotent stem cell biology and looking to take the next step in their career within Research at MCRI.

The Research Assistant role will report to Prof Melissa Little and will work under the direct supervision of Dr Jessica Vanslambrouck.

Your Responsibilities will include:
Maintenance of human pluripotent stem cells and differentiation to kidney cell types and organoids.
Cell and tissue culture, immunofluorescent staining, microscopy (fluorescence and brightfield), qRT-PCR, flow cytometry, and general molecular biology tasks as instructed by Dr Vanslambrouck.
Accurate and orderly digital record keeping and data storage.
Assistance in the generation of high-calibre research data for publication, analyses, and presentations.
Ordering and laboratory maintenance tasks.

About You:
Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline of science, with a preference for Masters/Hons graduates.

Skills and experience in cell and molecular biology.
Experience in cell/tissue culture.
Experience in cell/tissue analyses (immunofluorescence staining, fluorescence microscopy, and quantitative PCR [qRT-PCR]).
Experience and/or knowledge of general molecular biology techniques (e.g. RNA extraction, cDNA synthesis).

Cover letter
Resume
Responses to key selection criteria via position description

A new opportunity reporting into the Head of Digital Strategy Transformation has become available on a full time, permanent basis. This role can be based out of our Melbourne, Sydney or Brisbane office locations.
If you have a passion for software development and are looking for a role to kick start to your career in a large enterprise organisation, then this may be the role for you! This role will suit a positive and upbeat team player who is a proactive problem solver. In this role you will be given the chance to skill-up, receive mentoring, training and really develop in your profession.
As a front-end developer you will work closely with our experimentation team to identify, create and execute A/B Tests with the goal of optimising in market features using A/B Testing tools like Adobe Target.
How will I help?
Key accountabilities include but are not limited to:
Contributing to the design, development and deployment of A/B experimentation and feature optimisations via Adobe Target for our web platforms built in React, Angular, Sitecore and Shopify.
Contribute ideas for both solution and product design and architecture
Collaborate with Analytics to synthesise experiment results and provide recommendations that can be progressed forward for a clear outcome
Work independently and collaboratively in a creative and agile team, with a heavy focus on working with our testing team
Contribute to our development toolchain and methodologies
What’s in it for me?
As well as a competitive salary, a range of Bupa benefits and flexible working/ work from home arrangements, you’ll be challenged and encouraged to innovate. You will partner with colleagues who are dedicated to delivering exceptional experiences. We respect and consider everyone, knowing your difference will make the difference.
Perk highlights:
Discount on our health insurance, travel, car, home, contents and pet insurance products as well as discounts when you attend a Bupa Dental clinic or purchase glasses from a Bupa Optical store.
A dedicated internal wellbeing team provides you with a range of services, such as a global resilience program, regular training opportunities on a range of wellbeing topics and access to a variety of wellbeing discounts.
An additional well-being day each year to treat yourself.
What do I need?
Bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science / Software Engineering or a related technical field
1-2 years' experience working in an agile development team
Great skills writing clean, efficient code
Understanding of A/B Testing methodologies
Deep understanding of data structures, how they are implemented and how to apply them to solve problems
Familiarity with the application of common design patterns
Real passion for collaborating with colleagues to build technical solutions to hard problems
Knowledge of HTML, CSS, JavaScript
Working knowledge of ECMAScript 2015 JavaScript concepts
Understanding of Web standards, REST architecture
Working knowledge of React preferred but not mandatory
Working knowledge of Adobe Target
About Bupa
Bupa is an international healthcare group which has a purpose to deliver longer, healthier, happier lives and making a better world for more than 70 years. In Australia and New Zealand, Bupa assists more than 5 million customers through a broad range of health and care services including health insurance, aged care, rehabilitation, dental, optical, medical, hearing and medical visa services.
Our people reflect the diversity of our community. At Bupa, your wellbeing, identity and own story is respected and valued.

About us - Trusted since 1888
Equity Trustees was established in 1888 and is now one of Australia's largest specialist trustee companies. We help our clients grow, manage and protect their wealth now and for generations to come. About the role:
The key purpose of role is to review, analyse and interpret data in relation to superannuation funds. A strong focus will be on ensuring accuracy of APRA data submissions and managing data. Another key area will be preparing high-quality reports in timely manner with relevant insights and trends in order to assist the Superannuation Trustee Office (STO) with business-critical decision making which are in best interest of members.
The role will assist the General Manager, Finance Oversight & Data with, but not limited to, the following:
Review and analyse APRA SDT data such as fund member profiles, investment performance and benchmarks, scale of the fund, financial metrics, fees and claims experience to identify and communicate key insights and flag any concern.
Post review provide final approvals for APRA SDT forms submission.
Manage APRA SDT activities by liaising with various internal & external stakeholders to comply with APRA SDT reporting requirement within statutory timeframe.
Review the quarterly and annual APRA data, perform quality checks to the source documents and provide feedback ensuring all regulatory APRA returns are lodged accurately and on time.
Populate data for annual Trustee Level APRA reports and ensure lodgement by due dates
Perform financial modelling as require
Prepare Board/Management reports and presentations and briefings for senior management and external stakeholders


What you'll need to succeed:
Demonstrated experience of at least 5 years in data analytics and reporting (Experience within Superannuation Industry in APRA Data will be viewed favourably);
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills;
Skill in interpreting data and communicating insights;
Highly organised & strong attention to detail to achieve deadlines with competing priorities;
Proven ability to work in a team environment, adapt and react to change;
Strong technical skills, with advanced skills in using Software Applications (Excel) and other analytical tools, - SQL, Power BI;
Flexibility and willingness to participate in projects or related activities;
Takes responsibility for areas of responsibility, provides high quality and timely results while offering flexibility and proactive approach;
Highly developed communication (both written and verbal) and interpersonal skills to ensure positive professional relationships with Clients, Senior Executives and Employees;
Self-motivated with the ability to work to deadlines (resilient), manage priorities and makes decisions at the appropriate level; and
Continuous performance improvement mindset.
Education:
Actuarial Science, Commerce, Investments/Finance, Mathematics/Statistics, Programming or equivalent
Actuarial Qualifications well regarded.
What we can offer you:
A warm, open and supportive culture
An attractive remuneration package, including reward and recognition programs
Paid parental leave and flexibility to help you achieve balance in your life
An individual learning and development budget to help you grow
A workplace volunteering and giving program to enable you to help others in the community
Group Salary Continuance insurance to protect you when you need it most
An employee wellness program, including discounted health insurance and an employee assistance program
Discounted tax and estate planning services
Great central Melbourne CBD location, modern office fit out and end of trip facilities.

The Opportunity

Apply your experience in molecular biology and bioinformatics techniques
Contribute to the development of new technologies for the detection of infectious diseases
Join CSIRO – Australia’s premier research organisation

CSIRO’s CSIRO Health and Biosecurity are seeking a Research Assistant to be part of the Host Response Team based at the Australian Centre for Disease Preparedness (ACDP) in Geelong. As a Research Assistant on our team, you will assist with projects focused on developing new technologies for the detection and diagnosis of infectious diseases. You will work with colleagues to progress projects relating to host-encoded microRNAs as disease biomarkers. Your experience will be in molecular biology, particularly RNA purification, quantitative real-time PCR and the preparation of cDNA libraries for next-generation sequencing. Experience with bioinformatics is also desired.

Your duties will include:
Purifying microRNAs and other RNAs from circulating biofluids including sera, milk and saliva.
Analysing microRNA expression using RNAseq and qRT-PCR.
Assisting with tasks including data analysis and project administration.
Recognising and exploiting opportunities for innovation and progressing opportunities for the further development or creation of new lines of research.
Utilising methodology to plan and prepare research projects.
Carrying out research investigations requiring originality, creativity and innovation.
Recording, managing, and analysing data/information using relevant domain data science techniques.

Location: Geelong, VIC
Salary: AU$87k – AU$98k plus up to 15.4% superannuation
Tenure: Specified term of up to 12 months / Full-time
Reference: 85773
To be considered you will need:
A relevant bachelor’s degree in Science or related disciplines, or equivalent relevant experience.
Experience in molecular biology techniques such as RNA purification, molecular cloning, polymerase chain reaction, gel electrophoresis, and cDNA library preparation.
Bioinformatics skills relating to the analysis of RNAseq or qRT-PCR data are desirable.
A high level of written and oral communication skills with the ability to represent the research team effectively internally and externally.
A record of innovation and creativity, including the ability & willingness to incorporate novel ideas and approaches into scientific investigations.

For full details about this role please review the Position Description.
Eligibility
To be eligible for this position, you must currently be residing in Australia as:
an Australian citizen or permanent resident
a New Zealand citizen or
an Australian temporary resident with the right to work for the duration of the proposed term (without the requirement for sponsorship by CSIRO). This does not include bridging and other visas which are dependent on the successful approval of future visas.
The successful applicant will be required to obtain and provide a National Police Check or equivalent as well as meet ACDP’s microbiological security requirements.
Flexible Working Arrangements
We work flexibly at CSIRO, offering a range of options for how, when and where you work.
Diversity and Inclusion
We are working hard to recruit people representing the diversity across our society, and ensure that all our people feel supported to do their best work and feel empowered to let their ideas flourish.
About CSIRO
At CSIRO Australia's national science agency, we solve the greatest challenges through innovative science and technology. We put the safety and wellbeing of our people above all else and earn trust everywhere because we only deal in facts. We collaborate widely and generously and deliver solutions with real impact.


Join us and start creating tomorrow today!

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we work closely with clients to embrace a transformational approach aimed at benefiting all stakeholders—empowering organizations to grow, build sustainable competitive advantage, and drive positive societal impact.

Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives that question the status quo and spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting, technology and design, and corporate and digital ventures. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, fueled by the goal of helping our clients thrive and enabling them to make the world a better place.

Digital BCG

BCG has a long history of driving growth by embracing innovation and new ways of thinking. Through DigitalBCG, we bring together a diverse mix of consultants and digital specialists to ensure that we are supporting our clients throughout their digital transformation journeys. We work with our clients to fully understand the impact of digital on their business and set priorities that will transform their vision into value. Whether it be developing new technologies to support their core business, making better use of their data, or pursuing entirely new sources of revenue, our aim is to achieve radical improvements in productivity, flexibility, and speed. We are innovating how our clients are using artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, internet of things, personalization, blockchain technologies, and more to gain competitive advantage.

DigitalBCG encompasses a broad set of data, digital, and technology capabilities from BCG consulting teams and practices, along with our business units such as BCG Digital Ventures, BCG Platinion, and BCG GAMMA.

Practice Area Profile

BCG's Technology Advantage (TA) practice focuses on helping clients deliver competitive advantage and business superior performance through the use of data, technology and digital. TA is the fastest growing practice at BCG and at the heart of the strategic impact we have with our clients. Our consultants and experts globally work across all industries and provide deep experience and expertise across a number of topics including: * Digital Transformation * Data & Digital Platforms * Software & Agile * Digitizing the Tech Function
What You'll Do

As a DigitalBCGer, you will work in BCG teams that partner with leading companies to shift mindsets, shape agendas, and create value through digital transformation programs. The work you do every day—uncovering deep insights and reimagining business models—will enable our clients to compete today and accelerate into the digital future. You’ll leverage your prior experience and build your comprehensive consulting skillset and digital expertise by working on a mix of digital and traditional BCG client cases across a range of topics:

Digital Transformation & Strategy: Help clients rethink the impact of digital on their business and accelerate their transformation efforts.
Customer Centricity: Reinvent the customer experience, leveraging journey maps, deep customer empathy, and data to create transformative digital interfaces, marketing strategies, and process innovations.
Digital Marketing & Personalization: Optimise digital marketing programs across all digital channels and levers, including precision marketing, and analytics-enabled, one-to- one personalization.
Big Data & Analytics: Drive transformational value through cutting-edge applications of AI and Machine Learning tools that are fully scaled into the business.
New Ways of Working: Build ongoing organisational change capabilities, and helping clients transform into digital enterprises that continue to develop and innovate with speed, at scale.
Transformation of the Technology Function and Technology Build: Redesign technology functions to improve flexibility, efficiency, and Business-IT alignment.

What You'll Bring (Experience & Qualifications)

6+ years’ experience in a strategy, management or technology consultancy, a digital/tech start-up, or industry experience aligned to various sectors
Breadth and depth across Tech/Digital Strategy and Transformation, CIO Advisory, Operating Models, Data & Analytics, Technology Architecture, Digital Operations (including IoT/OT), Artificial Intelligence (AI), Cyber Risk and Resilience
Experience leading high-performing case/project teams
Experience driving presales and proposal development through to client presentations
Ability to thrive in a hypothesis-based environment and frame strategic challenges from a digital/tech perspective
Strong analytical skills, problem-solving capability and conceptual thinking
Excellent communication, storylining, client-facing and consulting skills
Strategic mindset, presence and gravitas
Minimum Bachelor’s degree, preferably in IT/Computer Science, Engineering or a related discipline
MBA, Masters or PhD highly regarded
Flexibility to travel within A/NZ and Asia Pacific region (once restrictions allow).

Launching the second year of DoT’s inhouse graduate program focusing on Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) disciplines. With Victoria’s transport and road infrastructure currently expanding, we are looking for the best graduates to keep Victoria’s networks growing and developing.
The Department of Transport (DoT) brings together all transport modes to design, plan, build & operate Victoria's transport system. Our job is to further integrate the transport network & improve the delivery of services to Victorians for simpler, quicker, & safer journeys that connect people & places & support Victoria's prosperity & liveability. We're focused on outcomes that deliver more choice, connections, & confidence in our travel, ensuring the whole transport network works as one to deliver better services & outcomes. The department is committed to building a culture where we say 'yes' to flexible work arrangements, & support ways of working that help employees balance work &life. The department provides workplace adjustments for applicants with disabilities.
DoT STEM Graduate Program
Our STEM Graduate Program is a 3-year development program consisting of six 6-month rotations across your discipline. The first 2 years as a graduate you will receive tailored learning and development, mentoring & exposure days across the Victorian transport network; the 3rd year will be about accreditation. Graduates generally undergo a regional rotation to gain valuable hands on experience in a booming area of our business.
VPS 3 salary ($72,751 – $80,545) – level dependent on qualification
Professional development focusing on business, technical and leadership skills
Regional (or metro for regional grads) based rotation – Relocation and living allowance provided
Structured senior executive mentorship

Kick start a fruitful career within the transport industry
Connect with other emerging young professionals through the Transport Portfolio & State Government staff networks
Access professional development & mentoring opportunities at all stages of their careers

Job Description

The Data Operations Manager will be responsible for managing the development and support activities for the Common Data Platform and providing high quality data services to business users across the organisation - supporting effective business decision making and enhancing both financial and operational performance.
To be successful role, it will require a passion for data, experience in managing data warehouses and associated data load processes and a well-developed ability to coach and mentor team members to achieve great outcomes.
Reporting to the Head of BI & Data some of your responsibilities will be:
Develop the Data Operations team to ensure we have a breadth of developing expertise and provide input on the resourcing and capability gaps we are likely to face in the future to cover our evolving data needs.
Foster an agile, high-performance, collaborative culture which is creative, open, supportive and dynamic with high levels of continuous improvement mind-set.
Ensure strong team emphasis on platform reliability and automation
Define and monitor metrics that measure platform reliability, and track these metrics over time to improve performance
Define technical requirements that increase the level of automation used on the Common Data Platform
Strong emphasis and understanding of data quality
Ensure that the right data is available to BI analysts and end-users to produce high quality, timely data-driven analysis, insight and content.
Define metrics to measure data coverage, data completeness, and data accuracy
Engage with business stakeholders to gather business requirements and understand the business context of data and associated business processes &
Identify gaps in existing information provision and opportunities for new datasets to support for business decision making and operations

Qualifications

You are tertiary qualified - Undergraduate and/or graduate qualification in a discipline relating to Software Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Technology.
Essential to the success of this position you will need to have a passion for data and experience in data warehouse support and maintenance including MS SQL Server and AWS Redshift. Experience working with ETL tools including SAS Data Integration and strong programming skills in SQL and SAS.

About the Role:
As an Associate Data Analyst within the Data Analytics and Intelligence Unit, you will support EPA's goal of becoming a preventative, targeted, risk-based regulator. You will join a dynamic team as it grows and matures, and use your advanced analytical and critical thinking skills to uncover insights to support evidence-based decision making at all levels of the organisation.
EPA Associate Data Analysts work on delivering data analytics insights and reporting to a broad range of internal stakeholders.

The main objectives of the role are to:
develop insightful data analysis reporting, contributing to EPA's data analytics capability;
demonstrate best practice analytics procedures across EPA;
support stakeholders' data analysis needs.
To be successful in this role:
demonstrated experience in data science (statistics, modelling, time-series modelling, pattern or spatial analysis) using R;
demonstrated ability to analyse and interpret complex information and data sets from various sources to generate insights;
ability to work in a team to deliver data insights.
How to Apply:Applicants should submit:
Cover letter; addressing your experience, motivations and suitability to the role
Resume; including contact details of two referees
Applications close midnight Tuesday, 09 August 2022
All queries in relation to this role should be directed to Elleni Toumpas, Lead Data Analyst, Data Analytics and Intelligence, at Elleni.Toumpas@epa.vic.gov.au
Preferred candidates will be required to complete a Pre-employment Declaration and Consent form. Employment of successful candidates will be subject to a National Police Check.
At EPA Victoria, the safety of our people, stakeholders and community is our first priority, which is why all applicants are required to be fully COVID vaccinated with both doses or (approved exemption), in accordance with the Chief Health Officer directions. We are committed to providing and maintaining a working environment which is safe and without risk to the health of its workers and clients. For this role, you are required to submit proof of vaccination prior to commencement.
EPA Victoria is committed to supporting employees through flexible work arrangements and encouraging work/life balance. We are dedicated to maintaining a safe and inclusive work environment where all employees are respected, valued and supported. We proactively seek to employ a diverse workforce to leverage the varied ideas of all employees, that drive innovation and success in everything we do.
Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.
EPA Victoria welcomes applications from serving or past members of the Australian Defence Force.
If you require advice and support with the application process please contact the Recruitment team on 1 300 372 842.
EPA Victoria utilise an Order of Merit process whereby applicants deemed suitable may be retained on a Merit List, from which their application may be accessed for recruitment to this role within a 3-month period.
Note: Applications received via e-mail will not be considered.

Sleep Scientist – Grade 1

Casual positions available (approximately 20 hours per week)

Remuneration $31.08 – $42.43 per hour
+ superannuation, and exclusive of penalties and VIC EBA Sleep Scientist (Grade 1 – Year 1-6)

About the Role

Sleep Scientists are responsible for preparing and monitoring overnight polysomnography studies on evening and overnight shifts. The role includes patient preparation and education, maintenance of signal quality, CPAP titration or implementation, and basic sleep study analysis. Sleep Scientists must have a good knowledge of CPAP products and mask fitting, and adhere to infection control procedures during and at the completion of each sleep study. Administrative tasks must also be performed, i.e. completion of hospital documentation and sleep study records. This role reports to the Sleep Unit Manager.

About You

To be successful for this opportunity, it is vital for you to possess high-level communication skills, both verbal and non-verbal, as you will be working with a diverse range of patients. You will bring experience working within a Sleep Study program or unit along with a strong attention to detail and a passion for client care. The ability to engage with and create strong working relationships with patients, their families, clinical and non-clinical staff is essential. You will have an understanding of human respiratory system and neurological functioning. A basic knowledge of sleep disorders is preferred. Continual learning through in-service programs, and on-the-job experience is anticipated.
You will also bring:
Previous experience in Sleep Medicine is desirable but not essential.
Ability to learn and apply psychophysiological recording techniques.
Accurate and concise scientific reporting
Data collection proficiency
Any experience within a hospital will be well regarded
Bachelor’s Degree in Science, Bioscience or Applied Science equivalent is essential

The Mitcham & Warringal Sleep laboratories are two busy six bed facilities that routinely operate from Sunday to Friday. The successful candidates would be required to be available to work across both sites.
About Us
Owned and operated by Ramsay Health Care, Australia's largest and most respected private hospital operator, Mitcham Private Hospital offers a comprehensive range of medical, surgical, maternity and mental health services.
Located in Melbourne's eastern suburbs, Mitcham has established an excellent reputation for high quality patient care, customer service and staff satisfaction.
Mitcham Private Sleep Centre is a dedicated sleep disorder centre, located close to Mitcham Private Hospital, and has been providing services for the needs of Melbourne’s outer eastern communities since 1998.
The NATA accredited Sleep Centre provides quality, full Level 1, overnight sleep studies of the highest international standard for privately insured, DVA and self-funded patients and is supported by a team of accredited, experienced sleep and respiratory physicians, Scientists and nursing staff.
The Warringal Private Hospital, a 215 bed facility incorporating 11 state of the art operating theatres, has an established national and international reputation as a leading healthcare provider, achieving recognition in many specialties throughout the years, and leading medical tourism from all over the world. It has a cutting-edge Sleep laboratory offering 6 beds to our patients.
Ramsay focuses on maintaining the highest standards of quality and safety, being an employer of choice, and operating its business according to The Ramsay Way philosophy: "People Caring for People". Benefits of working with Ramsay include;
Flexible work practices to best match your work/life balance
Professional Development – Grow your career across our national network!
Employee assistance program
Industry discounts across private health insurance, retail services, financial services and more.
How to Apply
All applications must be lodged online. Please click the Apply button within this ad to lodge an application.
Requirements
Everyone who joins Ramsay:
Must be vaccinated against Covid-19 a vaccine approved by the Australian Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation
Must provide a National Police check conducted within the previous 12 months
According to the role, Ramsay may require a Working-With-Children check and proof of immunisation against infectious diseases
If you would like to discuss this opportunity please contact Carlos Pereira, Sleep Studies Unit Manager at pereirac@ramsayhealth.com.au

Work type:Fixed Term
Full time, fixed term for 12 months
Bundoora campus
HEO4 - TRP $77,052 - $81,520 per annum inclusive of 17% superannuation
About the position
The project team includes Australian and international senior researchers, a postdoc and postgraduate students. The RA will manage and search for data to contribute to a large database and website (globalants.org), assist with field trips and field trip organisation and measure ant physiological and ecological traits in the lab and the field.
Skills and Experience
To be considered for this position, you will have;
Bachelor of Science with Honours or Masters, specialising in Ecology or a related field
Experience in field ecology and/or keeping laboratory insect colonies
Experience in dealing with large datasets
Experience with insect identification
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent organisational skills and accuracy and attention to detail
Experience in statistical analysis
Demonstrated ability to work effectively as a team member
Physically capable of long hours of field work in difficult conditions
Please refer to the Position Description for other duties, skills and experience required for this position.

La Trobe University’s success is driven by people who are committed to making a difference. They are creative and highly motivated, pursue new ideas and create knowledge. Our teaching and research address some of the most significant issues of our time and we’re passionate about driving change through operational excellence to benefit the communities we serve.

About the role

Role Location: Melbourne/Sydney
Role Type: Permanent

This role supports the Licensee Remediation Team who review and rectify poor historic Financial Advice. Working with Case Managers you will perform calculations to determine any financial detriment to clients as a result of receiving poor advice. This role also supports the complaints and incidents teams in determining financial detriment to clients.

What will your day look like
Design, develop and complete end to end holistic compensation calculations within established policies, processes and procedures;
Conduct quality assurance checks to ensure appropriateness, accuracy and consistency of the remediation calculations;
Contribute to the development and maintenance of the financial models and tools to enhance efficiency and accuracy of the detriment analysis;
Work closely with the assessment team to ensure a timely delivery of client remediation results;
Provide and present detailed detriment analysis, data observations and reports to various stakeholders;
Support ANZ Remediation Support Services and broader PB&A teams through facilitating relevant training sessions and presentations and to contribute continuously to our process improvement
What will you bring?

To grow and be successful in this role, you will ideally bring the following:

Minimum 2 years of relevant experience in financial services
Tertiary qualification in Commerce, Accounting, Finance, Mathematics, Actuarial science, or any relevant majors
Experience in compensation calculations in large scale remediation programs (highly desirable)
Good understanding of investment and superannuation and other wealth products.
Strong communicational and interpersonal skills

So, why join us?

We’re reinventing the way we do banking, and our community of collaborative, innovative thinkers who create human-centred solutions are helping us get there. We’re responding faster to changing customer requirements, focusing on the things that matter.

We’ll also offer you the opportunity to develop your career, working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds, perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated and create a great place to grow, thrive and belong.

A happy workplace is a thriving one, and some of the perks you’ll get from being a Delivery and Governance Manager at ANZ are:

Lifestyle leave - top up your annual leave with up to four weeks of additional purchased leave or take a longer period of unpaid time off
Great discounts on our financial products, and an annual Superannuation top up payment of $500 for all female employees to address the Superannuation gender gap
Competitive parental leave policies for both mums and dads, with a lump sum childcare contribution when you return to work

We work flexibly at ANZ and encourage you to talk to us about how this role can be flexible for you and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability, let us know how we can provide you with additional support.

Interested in joining us?

Click Apply Now, or visit www.anz.com/careers to find out more or view other opportunities.

Job Description
Location: Melbourne | Western Metropolitan
Job type: Not provided
Organisation: Western Health
Salary: Salary not specified
Occupation: Health and Allied Health
Reference: 46631
A unique opportunity exists to join the Western Public Health Unit in the role of Junior Data Analyst.

The Western Public Health Unit (WPHU) has been established to strengthen the public health response to infectious diseases and other health issues in the Western metropolitan region of Melbourne. The Unit is part of a system of three metropolitan Public Health Units; WPHU, North-eastern (NEPHU), South-eastern (SEPHU) and six regional Public Health Units to provide a new state-wide system of public health delivery and oversight. WPHU is currently responsible for COVID-related public health control activities and is taking on increasing responsibility for other communicable disease and health promotion activities, as part of the State’s overall public health response.

The Junior Data Analyst is a member of the Data, Epidemiology and Surveillance (DES) team. The role reports to the Lead Epidemiologist, will work closely with and under the direction of the Data Analyst, and will involve some supervision of activities undertaken by Data Assurance Officers.

To be successful in this role you:

Will provide data management, report development, analytical and data visualisation support to the Western Public Health Unit, during a dynamic time in which the unit expands beyond COVID-19 public health control to other communicable diseases and health promotion.

Will have excellent data management and problem skills, a strong eye for detail, and the ability to apply your analytical and critical thinking skills under pressure

Will be developing your skills in quantitative analysis and data visualisation and the use of software such as PBI and R, and can learn quickly to develop new skills in this area

Will use your strong communication skills to train and support other staff in data management and be able to translate operational and research questions into analytic projects.

Need a relevant tertiary qualification in data science, analytics, public health, or health informatics, and/or proven success in a similar role.

Role specifications

Full time temprorary position until 30 June 2023

Remuneration: HS3 rate plus superannuation and salary packaging tax benefits. Employment prior to 30 September 2022 will also attract the State Government Winter Worker payment of up to $3,000.

About Us

Our workforce of over 11,000 employees is driven by our values of ‘Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Excellence and Safety’ (CARES). We value our people and provide them the opportunity to grow and develop. Our teams are friendly and supportive, ensuring we deliver a safe, person-centred and connected patient experience.

Western Health is in a period of rapid growth. Our services comprise of four acute public hospitals: Footscray Hospital, Sunshine Hospital (including Joan Kirner Women's and Children's), Williamstown Hospital and Bacchus Marsh & Melton Hospital. We also operate Sunbury Day Hospital, Hazeldean, Grant Lodge Residential Aged Care, as well as community health centres in Melton, Caroline Springs and Bacchus Marsh and a range of community-based services. We care for a diverse community of more than 1 million people with complex care needs ranging from Neonates to Geriatrics.

Our employees enjoy a wide range of benefits such as:

Professional development support

Career advancement opportunities

Salary packaging including novated vehicle leasing

Work-life balance


Western Health is an equal opportunity employer committed to attracting and retaining diversity in our workforce. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

Western Health is committed to providing a safe environment for the children and young people who are involved in our services, sites and operations. We follow and abide by all legislative requirements to keep children and young people safe.

All appointments are made subject to a satisfactory Police Record Check, an Immunisation status clearance (including evidence of COVID 19 vaccination) and (if applicable) a Working with Children’s Check.

Western Health do not accept unsolicited resumes/applications from Recruitment Agencies.
